ans.reasoning: The crossProduct method is directly responsible for calculating the cross product of two vectors. If there is an issue with how it computes the result based on the vector components, it will lead to the test failure.

The constructor initializes the vector components. If the values passed to it are incorrect or if there is an issue in how the constructor sets the values, it could lead to incorrect vector components being used in the cross product calculation.
The getY method returns the y component of the vector. If the y component is not set correctly, it will affect the cross product calculation.
The getZ method returns the z component of the vector. Similar to getY, if the z component is incorrect, it will also affect the cross product calculation.

The getX method returns the x component of the vector. While it is still important, the x component is less likely to be the cause of the failure since the test is specifically checking for cancellation effects, which are more likely to involve the y and z components.
